page.title: 09SMEATHARPE-LOCAL SERVICES
page.content: Living in a sparsely populated area means that people have access to few amenities. In Smeatharpe there is no street lighting, and refuse is only collected once a fortnight. A Devon County Council Library Van visits the village every two weeks and is well patronised, particularly by senior citizens and mothers who chose books for their children. The local baker from Churchinford delivers fresh bread three times a week, while the milkman from Luppitt calls with the same frequency selling dairy produce. A butcher's van from Hemyock calls twice a week and wet fishman also comes round. A green- grocer delivers fruit and vegetables. The postman delivers the mail in the morning. Collections are made from the postbox in the morning and after-noon, Sundays excluded.
